job_title: SVP / VP, Data Scientist, Business Analytics, Consumer Banking Group
skill:
SVP / VP
Data Scientist
Business Analytics
Consumer Banking Group
job_desc:
Business Function
As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you.
About this role
The Regional Data Science team is part of the Regional Business Analytics team for Consumer Banking Group. Our responsibilities include building the Data Science Solutions using advanced machine learning methods, recommendation engines, text mining solutions and customer models to increase the business impact and efficient customer management, as well as answer numerous business questions using statistical tools and data analysis.
Responsibilities
Involve in building cutting edge algorithms and working with state-of-art data science and machine learning tools such as Spark, Tensor Flow and will have mastery in any number of analytic platforms like SAS, SQL, Python, R. etc.
Work with large scale datasets, distributed Big Data Platforms for a variety of advanced analytics solutions across the Bank ranging from recommendation engines, Propensity models, customer segmentation, Graph models, pricing and more.
Work alongside BA Leadership, making regular presentation to senior management including C-level executives within the Consumer Bank Leadership across the region
Help the team with methodology and guidance in the areas of experiment design and data analysis.
Requirements
Masters or equivalent degree in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operation Research, or equivalent quantitative fields preferred. Strong mathematical and statistics background.
6-10 years of experience in industry (ideally consumer banking, ecommerce, telecoms, retail) and/or academia with demonstrated track record of innovative research and insight generation and implementation of insights into tools/processes delivering front end business results
At least 5 years of data mining and machine learning on large amount of data, building and implementing various statistical models.
Good understanding of technology tools especially those related to analytics, data & statistical modelling.
Programming experience in SAS (Base, Stats, Macro, EG, EM), R, Python, Spark, Tensorflow or other statistical programing software.
Familiarity with Hadoop, Hive, and Pig. Proficient in using databases like Teradata, Oracle, SQL Server, Neo4J etc..
Knowledge of internet marketing data collection and metrics as well as familiarity with digital analytics platforms like Google Adwords, Facebook Contextual marketing, Omniture/Adobe, Mediaplex, etc would be helpful.
Ability to communicate complex analysis/models across a diverse team.
Good written and oral communication skills
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

job_title: Associate / Analyst, Business Banking Relationship Manager, Consumer Banking Group
skill:
Associate / Analyst
Business Banking Relationship Manager
Consumer Banking Group
job_desc:
Business Function
We deliver a comprehensive suite of innovative banking services and financial solutions to individuals, ranging from the man-in-the-street to the mass affluent. Providing sound wealth management and financial advisory services, we help our customers make informed decisions about their money and are committed to helping them plan and achieve their life goals. Products and services within the Consumer Banking Group include loans, credit cards, investment and unit trusts, insurance and priority banking.
Responsibilities
Sales Performance:
Achieve sales revenue and customer acquisition targets established by the Bank
Manage a sales portfolio and build strong relationships to acquire new businesses and to achieve desired lending product targets
Participate in sales activities and marketing-related events like agency networking sessions may be required from time to time
Assess customer loan requirements and work out sound loan schemes to suit individual needs as well as business needs
Compliance:
Constantly upgrade and develop new skills through continual training, education and observations
Ensure that all sales processes are conducted in compliance with both internal and external regulatory guidelines
Ensure that all documentation are complete and in order in line with guidelines
Sales Related Service:
Achieve high standard of customer satisfaction and service quality
Ensure all customer requests are dealt with in a timely and consistent manner
Handle all walk-in customer queries, objections with accurate information
Minimise sales related errors and write-offs
Requirements
Degree qualification with 2-3 years of sales experience in either consumer banking or enterprise banking
Proven sales track record in the consumer or enterprise banking space
Knowledge of competitors and market place
Ability to network and build rapport with external stakeholders (corporations and potential referral agents)
Strong passion for sales along with good presentation and interpersonal skills
Strong analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills with ability to adapt to changes
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

job_title: Associate / Analyst, Corporate Action Processor, Institutional Banking Group Operations, Technolo...
skill:
Associate / Analyst
Corporate Action Processor
Institutional Banking Group Operations
Technolo...
job_desc:
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Job Purpose
It exists to ensure that clients’ entitlements to corporate action events are protected.
It is expected to meet or exceed clients SLA requirements and achieve high standard of quality and commitment by specifying the roles and responsibility of each staff.
Key Accountabilities
Timeliness – to ensure that all Corporate Announcements & processing are done within 24 hours of receipt of announcements or proceeds
Accuracy – to ensure at least 95% accuracy
Responsive – to ensure that all clients queries are responded to within 24 hours of receipt of query or if not to provide interim reply and to follow with a response within 3 days
Risk- to ensure that there are no critical audit findings / issues and to escalate any immediate and time critical issues to higher authorities.
People – to participate in staff surveys, attend training when nominated and be crossed trained in other areas of work within the section or across sections in order to become a well trained leave cover.
Responsibilities
Check and ensure that all corporate action events are processed correctly and promptly.
Ensure prompt notification to clients on voluntary corporate action events such as rights, dividend with options, expiry of warrants, redemption, etc.
Check that clients’ instructions are executed accordingly.
Ensure that clients’ entitlements are protected.
Handle clients’ enquiries and provide timely responses.
Maintain high standard of service quality.
Requirements
Degree in any discipline.
Minimum 2-3yrs of relevant experience in Corp Action.
Proficient in MS Office application.
Excellent interpersonal & communication skills.
Team player who can work independently with minimal supervision.
Able to thrive in fast paced environment.
Detailed and meticulous.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

job_title: AVP / Senior Associate, Service Manager, Treasures Private Client, Consumer Banking Group
skill:
AVP / Senior Associate
Service Manager
Treasures Private Client
Consumer Banking Group
job_desc:
Business Function
As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you.
Responsibilities
1. Service Management Performance
To attend to client queries on wealth management needs and use the relevant skills to probe and identify needs to provide appropriate solutions to clients
To achieve service standards set up for TPC staff to develop and improve client satisfaction and retention
To ensure all client instructions are dealt with in a timely and consistent manner while adhering to regulatory, compliance and internal security audit requirements
To attend all relevant training and briefings
To keep attuned to the current economic and financial markets to be current and proficient in attending to client’s queries
2. Customer Care
To ensure that results from monthly service monitoring sessions and customer satisfaction surveys: e.g. quality visits / mystery shopping are in adherence with the set standards
3. Service Improvement Programme and Teamwork
To participate in Service & Process Improvement initiatives and other team-related activities
Work closely with relevant support units to ensure customer’s instructions are being handled on timely manner
4. Activities/Operations
Attend to and follow-up on client requests/issues daily.
Ability to interact with employees & clients of all levels and have developed strong inter-departmental and client relationship
Referring business opportunities from existing portfolio of clients to Relationship Managers
To identify opportunities and provide information and updates on investment products and services offered
Demonstrate clear support for other colleagues – training, guiding, mentoring and motivating
To conduct regular portfolio reviews with clients
Identify referral opportunities for new account opening: e.g. Member-Get-Member and support acquisition programs
5. Support and Alignment to Bank Strategic Focus and Vision
Aligned with Bank’s key strategic focus and to demonstrate support and fulfilment towards these visions: i.e. Application in daily interactions and BAUs
Receptive to changes and innovations and able to think out of the box to generate ideas and contribute to positive re-definition of end to end experiences for clients and internal stake holders alike
Support innovation and digital initiatives in line with business directives and scorecard
Requirements
Minimum 4 years relevant working experience
Sound knowledge of banking products, services and procedures
Customer service oriented
Good understanding of financial, investment products & services including Equity and Bond markets
Strong knowledge of compliance and regulatory requirements and exposure to multi-cultural issues would be an added advantage
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

DBS’ Private Banking offers a one-stop, full-service touch-point for total banking requirements and provides the highest level of personalised banking. We have a team of dedicated, experienced investment advisors who identify opportunities in the various asset classes and employ the best strategies and product vehicles to cater to each client’s needs. Coupled with partnerships within the DBS network and with global institutions, we strive to build long-term relationships with our Private Banking clients in Asia by providing them with high quality, timely and extensive wealth management, investment and financial solutions.

Jointly develop and maintain key client relationships with Relationship Mangers via providing prompt market updates, portfolio investment advice and facilitate quality execution of services/offerings.
Partner Relationship Managers to review and regular monitoring of client portfolios via appropriate investment strategies/offerings.

Ensure risk ratings of products sold to clients are suited for their risk profiles
Ensure audit trail and maintain records of clients communication & comply with documentation requirements

Degree holder in Finance, Business or related discipline
More than 10 years of portfolio management experience in financial institutions
Preferably with experience in building and leading high performing teams
Strong understanding of financial and investment markets
Analytical mind and sensitive to financial market trends

job_title: Project Manager, Banking
skill:
.Net Project Manager
Java/J2EE
Project Manager
job_desc:
Responsibilities
Manage the implementation of the project on a daily basis with regard to schedules, budget, manpower and quality.
Analyse and document requirements by liaising with a range of people including users and managers.
Establish and prepare project plans, risk management plans, project milestones and deliverables in consultation with business users and architect/designer.
Manage the scope definition and change control mechanism.
Escalate and discuss project overrun issues, scope creep, integration issues, resource requirement.
Manage integration of various components of the project including hardware, software installation, testing, business process review, redesign, application development, migration and data conversion, etc.
Manage project activities to ensure timely delivery, including identification of critical path, monitoring and driving completion of interdependent activities and adjustment to project schedules.
Achieve overall completion deadline.
Manage resources including hardware, software, human resource facilities and logistics required for project
Ensure meeting the customers requirement and conforms to quality management process, standards and procedures to minimise rework and system failures.
Define project resources, performance reviews and post implementation evaluations.
Negotiate with vendors and across teams to ensure adequate resources are available during various phases of the project.
Build relationships with users, technical staff and management to determine and resolve issues associated with systems implementation.
Manage contracts and subcontractors.
Negotiate with customers on change request effort, schedules and prioritize changes based on business needs.
Clear and open communication with customers on project issues or clarifications.
Liaise with team members to ensure that all tasks and deliverables are proceeding according to schedule.
Plan, track, and monitor the tasks assigned to the team leader/members.
Delegate tasks effectively by providing clear and specific instructions and goals.
Provide leadership to the project team to ensure that proposals/enhancements are fully analysed and evaluated for their benefits and costs.
Provide the project team with accurate information about business needs and priorities as well as details about existing business systems.
Participate in leadership activities and providing performance feedback and developmental coaching.
Monitor and improve team performance, providing leadership, coaching, and performance management.
Requirements
Degree in Information Systems or its equivalent.
Certified in IT Application Project Managementis a plus.
At least 5 to 6 years of IT project management experience in .Net applications project in a banking domain.
Must have dealt with
P&L
previously.
Experience in the development, implementation and support of information technology projects in a range of organizations.

job_title: Business Development Manager (Personal Banking)
skill: Business Development Manager (Personal Banking)
job_desc:
At Prudential, we understand that success comes from the talent and commitment of our people. Together, we have a shared vision in securing the future of our customers and our communities. We strive to build a business that
you
can shape, an inclusive workplace where
everyones
ideas are valued and a culture where
we
can thrive together. Our people stay connected and tuned in to whats happening around us, keeping us ahead of the curve. While focused on the long-term, we look to the future to bring growth, development and benefit to everyone whose lives we touch.
Job Profile Summary:
The Business Development Manager is responsible for the overall BAU operations to ensure that all processes are in place and running effectively and efficiently. This includes being central point of contact for managing the overall partnership with the Bank and to ensure all processes are in place and identify synergies across projects and initiatives to facilitate collaboration
Job Description:
Devise and execute customer/product propositions/strategies to raise productivity within Bank Wealth Banking and Privilege Banking segments
Work closely with Bank stakeholders (Team Heads, Bankers, Bancassurance Managers, Cluster Heads) to ensure achievement of Bancassurance targets, the manager is also required to share market intelligence, sales/customer statistics and sales concepts with the relevant stakeholders.
Identify individual sellers who need additional coaching to meet higher production targets.
Devise coaching methodology and conduct effective coaching sessions
Perform regular morning briefing at branches or segment gathering to drive desired agenda
Perform adhoc request to assist, facilitate or coordinate with segment activities such as seminars and briefings
Who we are looking for:
Competencies & Personal Traits
Exhibit ability to deliver effective communication and excellent interpersonal skills
Possess strong leadership qualities and a mind towards excellence
Analytical and strong problem solving abilities
Dynamic individual who strives in fast moving environment
Strong analytical, quantitative, problem solving, communication (written and verbal), presentation, and relationship management skills; with a high degree of tact.
Working Experience
Diploma / Degree with at least 3-5 years of relevant experience with successful track records
Prior Bancassurance experience preferred
CMFAS certification Module 5, 8, 8A, 9, 9A & HI (Preferred)
Education
Diploma/Degree in Finance/Business relevant fields of studies
Language
English

skill:
SVP
Development Lead (Web/App Studio)
Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology
...
job_desc:
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities
Deliver seamless consistent customer journeys across all domains across countries
Be the subject matter expert for delivery of native customer experience across android, iOS and react based web platforms
Use automated pipelines to deliver high quality code
Create innovative frameworks for developers to write code in the most efficient manner
Drive adoption of the framework across various technology teams
Champion the cause of reuse and lead the development teams to deliver high quality code
Bring product thinking into all business requirements across countries
Interface with business, UX and technology teams to drive to common requirements
Spear lead the automation initiative across all domains
Survey market landscape for solution/application insights, direction, vendors, and methods
Work and drive vendors to provide relevant solutions
Interface with technology teams from other platforms as appropriate
Instrument the pipelines to ensure process is followed and present metrics to senior management stakeholders
Drive POCs to assess new solution/application paths
Build competency center and subject matter expertise that business and tech stakeholders can depend on
Requirements
Hands-on experience with swift, java and react.
Hands on experience with CI/CD pipelines
Proven leadership in delivering frameworks at enterprise level
Understanding of test and build automation frameworks for web and mobile front-ends and backend

job_title: VP, Discretionary Portfolio Manager, Private Banking, Consumer Banking Group
skill:
VP
Discretionary Portfolio Manager
Private Banking
Consumer Banking Group
job_desc:
Business Function
DBS’ Private Banking offers a one-stop, full-service touch-point for total banking requirements and provides the highest level of personalised banking. We have a team of dedicated, experienced investment advisors who identify opportunities in the various asset classes and employ the best strategies and product vehicles to cater to each client’s needs. Coupled with partnerships within the DBS network and with global institutions, we strive to build long-term relationships with our Private Banking clients in Asia by providing them with high quality, timely and extensive wealth management, investment and financial solutions.
Responsibilities
Discretionary Portfolio Management team manages portfolio of high net worth clients who have delegated the management of their portfolio to DBS bank.
The team is currently looking to add a portfolio manager to the team.
The role focuses on managing and implementing mandates, taking into consideration the client’s objectives and restrictions. Discretionary portfolio manager oversees investment decisions and client portfolio performance in their area of coverage.
Other key responsibilities include:
- Executing trades in relation to the investment strategy.
- Work and communicate with relationship managers updates on client’s mandates.
- Participate in any related investment project by the business.
Portfolio manager is accountable for security selection in his/her area of coverage as well as the overall contribution to client portfolios and compliance with mandate guidelines. Portfolio are run on a team approach therefore extensive collaboration as well as team contribution is expected.
Requirements
Degree in Finance or Economics
At least 6 years of relevant experience as portfolio manager with a private bank or asset management firm.
Computer literacy and good knowledge of financial software
Experience in managing single or mixed assets portfolios
Strong communication and stakeholder management abilities – to provide advisory services and expert views to clients and internal stakeholders
Excellent analytical skills and a thorough understanding of portfolio performance and risk metrics
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

job_title: Associate, Intelligent Banking Advocate, Intelligent Banking, Consumer Banking Group
skill:
Associate
Intelligent Banking Advocate
Intelligent Banking
Consumer Banking Group
job_desc:
Business Function
As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you.
Responsibilities
Assist in the development of a comprehensive Customer Interaction Map and Model, and align to both new and existing CBG segments, channels and platforms (eg PAYLAH, WECHAT).
Proactively partner with existing CBG squads to deliver improved DVC journey for selected ecosystem
Significantly enhancing customer journeys through strategic consolidation and optimization of presentment options on digital platforms, apps, tablets etc.
Review, optimize, facilitate and maintain customer engagement and stickiness through community and social media channels
Facilitate effective omni-channel interactions by unifying and empowering the customer experience real-time through appropriate digital channels so lifetime value can be captured
Create more intelligent ways to authenticate customer onboarding experience (eg finger print, voice, facial recognition, intelligent live chats, iBOTs) and map strategic linkages to existing ecosystem.
Implement and drive KPI metrics to measure impact of intelligent banking (increasing acquisition, improvement in customer experience and loyalty, reducing customer complaints etc)
Create strong partnership and collaboration across other CBG verticals (Products, Distribution and Enablers) and including other support stakeholders (eg T&O, Ops Risk, etc)
Learn from FINTECH’s best practices (Alipay, Wechat, Amazon, Google etc) to create winning formulas for CBG’s "next" practices.
Requirements
Up to 5 years of working experience, in a similar capacity with a proven ability to drive customer interaction and engagement from an omni-channel perspective
Familiar with CBG business, services, products, lifecycles and how these are linked into the CBG eco-systems
Passionate about delivering best of class capabilities, including producing seamless and superior customer experience and engagement.
Strong communication skill is a must. Candidate must be comfortable to multi-task and integrate across all products, distribution and business-enabling channels.
Exposure of community and social media interactions, including experience as a blogger or influencer, will be useful.
Knowledge of best-in-class Fintech apps or content providers (eg. WeChat, AliPay, Amazon, etc) will be desirable.
Adept working with tools, applications and systems which embraces Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML) and IOT (Internet of Things)
Data Scientists and/or Gaming Programmers who has the tenacity to disrupt, transform, engage and scale up on digital acquisition and enhance customer fulfillment journeys will be critical to success.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

job_title: VP/AVP, KYC Specialist, Private Banking, Consumer Banking Group
skill:
VP/AVP
KYC Specialist
Private Banking
Consumer Banking Group
job_desc:
Business Function
DBS’ Private Banking offers a one-stop, full-service touch-point for total banking requirements and provides the highest level of personalised banking. We have a team of dedicated, experienced investment advisors who identify opportunities in the various asset classes and employ the best strategies and product vehicles to cater to each client’s needs. Coupled with partnerships within the DBS network and with global institutions, we strive to build long-term relationships with our Private Banking clients in Asia by providing them with high quality, timely and extensive wealth management, investment and financial solutions.
Responsibilities
Highlight deficiencies, suspicious AML or other non-compliance issues to relevant parties and management.
Co-ordinate and organise High Risk Customer Committee (HRCC) meetings, and ensure sufficient quorum for meeting to proceed.
Document and distribute minutes of meeting for each case, noting the committee’s decision, conditions and follow-up actions.
Update HRCC master register on all cases discussed, with committee's decision, conditions, follow-up actions and status.
Advise Front Office on the onboarding requirement in accordance to DBS's AML/KYC standards and regulatory requirement, and partner with Front Office to meet the requirement.
Review and corroborate KYC information submitted by RM, perform an independent review and risk rate customer in accordance to regulatory requirement as well as Group AML/CFT policy and procedures.
Follow up with RM & ARM and other stakeholders on KYC related matters and for escalated / prioritised cases.
Assess and ensure the relevance and completeness of KYC information supplied by Front Office and perform appropriate due diligence checks and information searches to comply with bank standards of client onboarding.
Requirements
Bachelor Degree with at least 6 years of working experience in KYC/AML areas, risk or controls functions, in Private Banking.
Familiar with regulatory requirements pertaining to KYC / AML, e.g. MAS 626.
Certifications in AML such as Certified Anti Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) or International Association Diploma in Anti Money Laundering would be an advantage.
Ability to be client centric while balancing business needs and controls.
Excellent interpersonal skills to manage relationships with Front Office stakeholders.
Effective writing and organizational skills with keen eye to details.
An efficient solutions provider with strong analytical and creative problem solving skills.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Support ad-hoc queries and projects

5 to 7 years of experience in management accounting or financial reporting analysis in Retail Banking or Wealth Management

A self-starter, independent and be able to thrive in a fast paced and changing environment

job_title: AVP, Business Finance, Regional Private Bank, Group Finance
skill:
AVP
Business Finance
Regional Private Bank
Group Finance
job_desc:
Business Function
Group Finance aims to deliver world-class standards in reporting, financial planning and finance processes. We provide insights and analyses that help the bank make sound business decisions – whether in the areas of product development or customer profitability. We also provide capital management, business planning, forecasting, and tax and accounting advisory services.
The bank is also a certified Accredited Training Organisation (ATO) for the Singapore Qualification Programme by the Singapore Accountancy Commission and an Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA) Approved Employer.
Responsibilities
Partner with Wealth business in developing a deep understanding of key performance drivers in order to provide independent inputs on business trends.
Facilitate fact-based discussion on key business issues underpinning profitability and productivity.
Help business identify profitable opportunities and areas for collaboration within the Bank.
Provide business finance support for new projects and initiatives (e.g. new product launches, system enhancements, and strategic cost management).
Plan, implement or improve finance system and processes to increase growth of private bank business and reduce manual processes
Support monthend activities – accruals, MIS adjustments, GLAO, etc.
Management reporting – Monthly Performance Analysis, Weekly Flash and Quarterly Forecasting, Annual Budgeting, etc looking at product level, in areas of revenue, margins, volumes, direct and allocated expenses, headcount
Produce relevant monthly performance reports at RM/Client/Marketing Team/Product level to help to support the business
Provide commentaries on MoM, YoY, QoQ variances and vs Budget
Work closely with Country business finance teams and Group MIS/Policy/Tax/Financial Accounting/Capital teams for monthly submission of actual, flash, forecast and budget
Provide advice and support to business with regards to accounting policy and financial controls. Implement new or changes in Accounting policies and Regulations and monitor adherence, where applicable to the business
Coordinate with Business, Operations, Technology and Finance partners to ensure that business transactions are properly recorded
Work with relevant support units on allocated cost management
Requirements
Degree in Accountancy and/or Computing is preferred.
Minimum 7 years of experience in management reporting and data analytics
Good knowledge of financial products and services, preferably in the Wealth business
Meticulous, detailed, hands on with good aptitude for numbers and strong analytical skills. Comfortable dealing with high volume of data and financial numbers
Team player with good interpersonal, communication and problem solving skills
Comfortable in dealing with senior business stakeholders
Well-versed in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, Microsoft PowerPoint, Hyperion tools and Essbase.  Possessing SQL/Macro skills is an advantage.
A self-starter, independent and be able to thrive in a fast paced and changing environment
Highly driven
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

job_title: VP/AVP, Production Support Manager (Ecosystem/Paylah)Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytic...
skill:
VP/AVP
Production Support Manager (Ecosystem/Paylah)Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytic...
job_desc:
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities
The role will focus on problem solving and production support for the DBS Paylah application. It requires you to be a quick learner with good troubleshooting skills.
Debug production issues by digging into the application code, writing support related helpers and ad-hoc scripts, System automation and optimizations. This is a very DevOps aligned production management role.
The role implies extensive collaboration with the developers, business users and the wider regional production support teams. It requires you to be an effective communicator and a team player. Design, implement, fix and recommend strategies to automate for a very reliable production system/flow. Being technically hands-on will help in this aspect. The role is expected to involve production incident management, root cause analysis (RCA) and related follow ups to ensure closure of the issue.
The role will need to plan, manage, monitor and optimize the production related & related capacity and resiliency management.
Requirements
At least 8 years of experience and strong understanding of support incident, change and problem management process
Minimum 5 years of experience doing L2/L3 production support, preferably in banking/finance Technology domain.
Minimum 3 years of exposure of Amazon Web Services ( EC2, ELB, VPC, S3, CloudFront, IAM, RDS, Route 53, CloudWatch, SNS,).
Minimum 3 years of hands-on experiences in Linux OpenShift, Docker Containers and Kubernetes.
Good understanding of microservice architecture and RESTful API integration patterns.
Involved in installation, configuration and administration of RHEL 5x/6.x Servers.
Providing data for a weekly and monthly report to senior management.
Monitor Production Server Health of different parameters (CPU Load, Physical Memory, Swap Memory, Hard disk, Mysql service, Http service and response time)
Installation of Packages, Patch Management and Upgrades.
Effectively communicate issues and status updates with business support, regional colleagues, and development teams.
Quick thinker, problem solver (even under pressure) and a fast learner under constantly changing environment.
Very good communication skills, be able to communicate effectively to both business and technology partners.
Knowledge in iChamp (or similar incident ticketing tools).
Knowledge in Monitoring tools (such as Grafana).
Qualifications
Bachelor Degree in Engineering or Computer Science
Strong Java skills
ITIL Foundation V3/2011 certification preferred
DevOps certification preferred
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

job_title: Private Banking Project Manager (12 months contract)
job_desc:
Job Description :
Our client is investing significantly in its Private Banking and Wealth Management capabilities to improve the Digital experience of clients and RMs and increase efficiency. The delivery Programmes within the PBWM portfolio are each aligned to a key product area or client segment, and span business change and technology delivery teams.
The Programme Manager will work closely with the Programme Accountable Executive, Product Owners and Technology Delivery Head to define and manage the delivery of technology solutions for PBWM clients. They will be responsible for implementing and maintaining effective controls and governance across all programme teams and stakeholder groups, and will foster collaboration both within the programme and with broader Private Banking & Wealth Management teams to drive effective execution.
Programme Governance
Manage the programme governance framework and be responsible for its effectiveness in providing oversight and direction to the product delivery teams.
Prepare and deliver reporting materials to programme and portfolio level governance forums, ensuring timeliness, accuracy and relevance of data. Own the key messages to be delivered and approvals sought.
Maintain the Programme Execution Document, detailing the budget, scope, resource and benefits for the programme; support the Accountable Executive in presenting the PED for approval by the Portfolio Governance Committee and for formally accepting subsequent changes.
Implement and maintain the processes for reporting progress from Agile delivery teams to the programme and portfolio steering groups; keep all stakeholders informed of status.
Ensure the programme has an effective structure for the management of risks and issues; that they are identified, maintained, reviewed, addressed and escalated in a timely manner.
Responsible for alignment of the programme governance with bank standards, working closely with ePMO to define the implementation of the standards within the programme management plan.
Provide a programme quality assurance capability; conduct scheduled and ad hoc reviews of all programme materials, and ensure that programme data is complete and accurate in the enterprise reporting system (Clarity).
Financial Management
Prepare the programme budget as part of the PED and maintain it through the duration of the programme.
Work with ITO Finance and other groups to provide an accurate view of actual spend; track and provide evidence for accruals, recharges and third party spend.
Ensure accurate and realistic forecasts are maintained; monitor and follow up on variances; support the Accountable Executive in meeting the programme's financial commitments in each year and over the life of the programme.
Encourage and enforce high standards of quality, accuracy and consistency in all project and programme logs, trackers and reporting materials.
Identify impact on critical processes within the Bank's operational risk framework, and work with process owners and project teams to ensure robust controls.
Develop commercialisation plans and training material, co-ordinate briefings, design and execute communication plans. Gather feedback post-implementation, and track benefits captured.
Participate in review meetings and identify/highlight any potential issue that may impact project's cost, timeline and/or scope and work with concerned stakeholders for its early resolution
Coordinate with Regional and Country counterparts / stakeholders in delivering the above. Role is global, physical location is with the global PBWM team in Singapore. May require occasional travel depending on specific projects.
Candidate Requirements:
4+ years banking experience as a Programme PMO, or as a senior PMO, within a large scale multi-year programme or a global Private Banking or Wealth Management business. Consulting experience at a top tier firm also preferred.
PMP or CAPM certification preferred
Excellent knowledge of Programme Governance disciplines (planning, reporting, risk management, QA, document management, financials, benefits, resource management, stage controls, stakeholder management and governance).
Strong practical knowledge of project or programme delivery in an Agile environment.
Experience in managing external vendors
Experienced in supporting a global group and ability to work in a highly collaborative manner across the network with a wide range of stakeholders.
Strong skills in conceptual and quantitative problem-solving, aligning a broad range of stakeholders from multiple functions, and executing against a tightly-defined timeline.
Excellent professional skills, including verbal, presentation and written communication skills; ability to simultaneously "see the big picture" and manage the details of implementation; ability to follow through on execution.
Desirable:
Demonstrated knowledge of Wealth Management or Private Banking processes and technology systems
Experience in lean / six sigma process improvement preferred
Interested Project Managers who are comfortable to take on a 12 months extendable contract are encouraged to submit their CVs in MS Word format to cindy.tan@ambition.com.sg for an initial discussion.
Business Registration Number: 200611680D | Licence Number: 10C5117 | EA Personnel Registration Number: R1109257

job_title: Client On Boarding AVP - Corporate and Investment Banking
job_desc:
Job Description :
Our client is a well-established Global Bank with a strong commitment to implement and enhance a robust regulatory and supervisory regime related to KYC, AML and Financial Crimes. Our client is looking to hire an individual passionate about KYC and willing to be part of the remediation team.
As an experience KYC checker you will be in charge of:
Performing KYC for clients with different risk levels (High, Medium and Low)
Clearing the cases and will get exposure to various jurisdictions
Allocating the work to the team and act as a deputy for the head.
Implementing and ensuring efficient processes related to the financial crime risks associated.
Working closely with other teams such as Front office, Financial crime and KYC to imprve the On Boarding's end to end process.
To qualify, individuals must possess:
- Minimum 8+ years' significant practice in KYC and Client On Boarding or off boarding with at least 3 years as a checker.
- Exposure to various jurisdictions within APAC
- Banking background is a must to have
- Strong technical KYC knowledge and quality assurance are preferred to look at control improvements.
If your profile meets the requirement above, feel free to apply directly or contact me for further information.
Kindly note that only successful candidates will be contacted.

join
our fantastic recruitment business. To
apply
for Ambition's current global opportunities
click
.

job_title: AVP / Senior Associate, Treasures Customer Service Manager, Treasures Offshore, Consumer Banking ...
skill:
AVP / Senior Associate
Treasures Customer Service Manager
Treasures Offshore
Consumer Banking ...
job_desc:
Business Function
We deliver a comprehensive suite of innovative banking services and financial solutions to individuals, ranging from the man-in-the-street to the mass affluent. Providing sound wealth management and financial advisory services, we help our customers make informed decisions about their money and are committed to helping them plan and achieve their life goals. Products and services within the Consumer Banking Group include loans, credit cards, investment and unit trusts, insurance and priority banking.
DBS Treasures (Priority Banking) is where our customers will find the widest range of products, from banking, insurance and investment to Best-In-Class treasury products in Singapore. It is also where we have a team of leading wealth managers. If you are a high achiever and aspire to advance and build your sales career, seize this opportunity now - join us.  We have a large and growing base of customers who are in need of your superior service and professional advice.
Responsibilities
Responsible for Treasures Offshore operations and ensure that the team is performing at optimum productivity and efficiency levels
Ensure that customer requests are dealt with in a timely and consistent manner while adhering to regulatory, compliance and internal security audit requirements
Responsible for complaint investigation and resolution, management of customer feedback as well as proactively providing feedback to Treasures Relationship Managers to maintain a high standard of customer service and adhering to committed turnaround times
Oversee, implement and maintain intra-departmental operational processes to improve service turnaround and ensure timely processing
Conduct monthly Service Monitoring Sessions to assess staff performance and customer satisfaction
Responsible for regular coaching and training of Treasures staff in terms of achieving service standards and adherence to regulatory, compliance and internal security audit requirements as well as Treasures Standard Operating Procedures
Provide supervision on team operations
Perform compliance reviews and KYC assessments (client due diligence, name screening and transaction review) and take adequate measures to establish the source of wealth and source of funds of customers
Ensure customers’ KYC records are up-to-date and complied in accordance with the current AML/CFT procedures, internal guidelines and other relevant regulatory requirements
Facilitate approvals from Senior Management for high risk customers (including PEPs and significant AUMs) and escalate AML related risk issues to Group Compliance.
Requirements
Degree with at least 5 years' of relevant experience, preferably in financial services industry
Strong knowledge of banking products, services and procedures
Good understanding of financial, investment products and services including equity and bond markets
Solid knowledge of compliance and regulatory requirements as well as exposure to multicultural issues
Good planning and organising capability
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Strong supervisory, problem solving and decision making skills
Self-motivated team player with good sales/service aptitude who enjoys working in a fast-paced sales environment
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

job_title: AVP / Snr Associate,  Sr. Frontend Developer,  Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Tech...
skill:
AVP / Snr Associate
Sr. Frontend Developer
Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Tech...
job_desc:
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Key Accountabilities
DBS Consumer Banking and Group Technology is looking for passionate Frontend Engineers to work on our in-house Web Framework for crafting and assembling our next generation consumer experiences.
If you are the kind of engineer who is passionate about bringing great experiences to life and love working in a collaborative environment with your product and experiences, then we want to talk to you.
Responsibilities
Develop applications following best practices of accessibility and test-driven development.
Create reusable, testable, organized, efficient, and self-documenting code/components.
Partner closely with design and product teams to craft product experiences while providing technical guidance and solutions
Deliver code in a DevOps environment.
Encourage code craftsmanship across team.
Deliver code in an agile team environment.
Lead code reviews to drive teams to the highest standards for web apps.
Drive teams to follow clean code principles.
Requirements
:
7+ years professional application/frontend development experience.
Hands on experience on at least two of the following JavaScript frameworks
EMBERJS
REACTJS
ANGULAR (1.x or >2)
BACKBONE
DOJO
A sound understanding of Redux, Webpack, Styled-components, ES6, Jest.
A solid experience building applications on top of RESTful APIs.
NodeJS Experience
Experience in UI testing and Code Quality Tools (Jasmine, Mocha, Cucumber, BDD, TDD, JSLINT, etc...)
Understand the paradigms and techniques associated with web page performance and degradation; how to analyze, apply measures, and resolve bottlenecks
Demonstrable experience in Object Oriented JavaScript without the use of a library or framework
Able to explain advanced concepts native to the JavaScript language - understanding of ECMA6 Standards is a big plus
Able to follow best coding practice with JavaScript. ie: avoiding global variables, namespaces, modularity, inheritance, performance, closures
Solid knowledge of algorithms, design patterns, and componentization approaches.
Experience with cross-browser, cross-platform, and design constraints on the web.
Experience with CSS pre-processors (SASS, LESS)
Ability to operate effectively both independently and within a team environment
Cloud experience a big plus
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

job_title: SVP, Infrastructure Lead, Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology an...
skill:
SVP
Infrastructure Lead
Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology
Technology an...
job_desc:
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Job Purpose
DBS Corebanking team is seeking a highly motivated, seasoned manager of infrastructure to transform and build out our Corebanking’s existing infrastructure into cloud platform infrastructure.  This person will lead DevOps engineers as they design and deploy automation and configuration management tools needed to provide a secured, scalable, reliable and fast platform for both our infrastructure and application services. 																																																						 																																																						 																																																						The successful candidate will have extensive experience managing infrastructure for secured, global, large scale, highly available services.  Technical and organizational vision, combined with flawless execution is critical to this role.  The role also requires strong partnership with engineering/development teams, production support, technical services support and vendors.
Responsibilities
As part of the Corebanking leadership team, drive the platform transformation to private/public cloud
Manage a team of infrastructure engineers to ensure the stability and high availability of infrastructure services for Corebanking applications
Build and foster a high performance culture, mentor team members and provide team with the tools and guidance to transform current infrastructure platform
Design, build and deliver a stable and highly scalable infrastructure based on latest technologies and best practice
Enhance performance throughout the infrastructure using automation framework and implement tooling to optimize performance, availability and costs
Plan, lead and drive projects through entire lifecycle for infrastructure
Create deployment strategies for existing and new services based on business objectives
Foster collaborative partnerships across functional teams including remote teams
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience
At least 10+ years of experience in web/cloud operations, administration and/or engineering with organizational leadership of large scale, global services
More than 15+ years of infrastructure engineering management experience
Hands-on experience scaling and managing cloud-based infrastructure will be  added advantage
Solid foundation in software engineering best practices
Experience with Scrum and agile development processes and methodologies
Well versed in tooling automation and CI/CD pipelines
Solid understanding of highly available, performant and secured service delivery
Thorough understanding of networking concepts, Internet protocols and network security
Hands-on experience with modern container orchestration systems
Clear communicator with a positive attitude
Team worker with good interpersonal skills, to facilitate working within the department, across the broader T&O department and with business partners and vendors.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Analyst / Senior Officer
Credit Operations – Merchant Chargeback

job_desc:
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Job Purpose
To process timely retrieval, chargeback and cardholder/merchant crediting & deduction in accordance with the relevant Operating Regulations and SLA
Responsibilities
Handle customer’s Credit Card/Debit Card transaction disputes
Processing/Checking of related activities in the end to end dispute cycle
Able to review and handle Retrieval Request/ Chargeback/ Representment/ Arbitration/ Compliance cases
Handling queries regarding customer’s transaction disputes
Pre-processing/Post-processing (Sorting, matching, uploading, filing of documents & data entry for Reporting & Monitoring)
Reconciliation of Financial entries for Credit/Debit Card transactions
Monitoring outstanding dispute cases in ITS Queues/ Retrieval Aging Reports/ GL listings/ Card Associations Platforms etc
Reporting of daily, weekly, monthly team performance and volume
Resolve all Cardholder/Merchant chargeback issues
Handle all operation issues
Requirements
Degree in any field.
Proficient in MS Office applications.
Have minimum 2 years of chargeback experience.
Able to work independently.
Able to multitask and handle different activities with different timelines.
Able to prioritise work according to different timeframes.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

job_title: Wealth Planning Manager (Branch/Non-Branch), Consumer Banking Group
skill:
Wealth Planning Manager (Branch/Non-Branch)
Consumer Banking Group
job_desc:
Help us delight our branch customers
DBS Consumer Banking Group offers a comprehensive suite of innovative banking services and financial solutions to individuals, ranging from the man-in-the-street to the mass affluent. Providing sound wealth management and financial advisory services, we help our customers make informed decisions about their money in order to achieve their life goals. Our products and services include loans, credit cards, investment and unit trusts, insurance, and priority banking.
As a
Wealth Planning Manager
with Asia’s best bank, you will be part of our award-winning team based in either a Branch or Non-Branch team to provide a personalized banking experience for our customers.
Fulfilling and varied, a typical workday might look like this:
Provide financial advice to clients through offering wealth management solutions, such as insurance, structured deposits, loans and unit trusts
Play an active part in planning campaigns across the bank or within the branch
Develop and strengthen long-term relationships with clients
If based in a Non-Branch environment, you will be assigned to a centralized office where focus will be on tele-prospecting
You will also be actively involved in seminars, events and sales campaign
We want driven, service-oriented individuals like you with:
A degree in any discipline
A willingness to work on a flexible schedule that includes weekends
A passion for banking and wealth management
What we offer
You can expect a competitive salary, a benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements. Find out more
here.
Ready to apply? Take the next step.
Click on the link below to apply and receive an email notification from our AI Chatbot, JIM within 2 hours
Interact and complete the mandatory assessments on JIM
You will be invited for a face-to-face interview with our Branch Manager and HR if you are shortlisted

job_title: Associate Recruitment Consultant-Banking & Financial Services
job_desc:
Job Description :
Ambition is a leading global boutique recruitment consultancy with 17 years' experience in Hong Kong and an enviable track record of success. We are a publicly-listed group with offices in Hong Kong Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, London, Sydney, Melbourne, and Brisbane. We continue to demonstrate significant growth through a robust, organic and acquisitive strategy.
An exciting opportunity exists for high calibre individuals to join our Banking and Financial Services Practice in Hong Kong. Our Banking and Financial Services Practice recruits across Finance, Operations, Internal Audit, Risk, Compliance, Sales and Marketing. We have an established client base, strong brand and a proven track record in Hong Kong built up since 2001.
Due to our unrivalled reputation, with long term, as well as, increasing number of new relationships in the market, we are looking for an Associate Consultant to join our expanding team in Hong Kong, focusing on one of our busy segments in our business. Candidates with more expereise may be considered for a Consultant position.
To qualify, individuals must possess:
A minimum of 2 years' experience working within Banking / Financial Services. Strong revenue performers in other related disciplines will also be considered
Excellent presentation and communication skills
A positive attitude and strong drive to succeed
Highly self-motivated and a desire for quick result
Cantonese ideal but not a pre-requisite
Proven ability to think outside the box and challenge the status quo
Interested applicants please contact Jasmine Heerema or click 'Apply Now'. For other opportunities and to learn more about Ambition, please visit

skill:
Data Analyst
Adobe Analytics
Tableau Developer
Qlik Sense
BI Reporting
SQL
Developer
Java
Data Modeling
Hadoop
Data Visualization
Big Data Engineer
Big Data Developer
job_desc:
You will be part of a very vibrant and dynamic team that is innovating the way the customers engage with bank through the most customized experiences possible. In joining the Engagement Lab as a Data Modeler, you’ll be in a key role that provides solutions for data management, data integration, data modelling and visualization.
We will be expecting you to have extensive experiences in all aspects of designing, constructing and managing data warehouses and operational data stores. The data engineer will also perform analysis of data requirements, data profiling and metadata mappings to create ideal data analytics environment for customer engagement .
Responsibilities
Design, develop and deploy strategic solutions on data management to meet the analytical needs of the Digital Bank
Develop and maintain data models and process workflow using the data that exists in Data Lake and/or source system.
Develop and maintain the metadata definitions, metadata repositories and corresponding documentations.
Ensure the data integrity, quality, consistency and stability.
Work closely with data analysts and data scientists to develop analytical solutions and support with data queries and data provisioning.
Work closely with IT groups and coordinate the requirements that involve data and/or analytics platform in Digital Bank, e.g. automation, optimization, UAT, tool deployment.
Undertake research to identify opportunities of sourcing new data.
Ensure the availability and maintenance of all analytics and visualization tools.
Maintain and monitor the developed dashboards / reports.
Requirements
Experiences in meta data management, data transformation, and data integration.
Knowledge of SQL database technologies, Hadoop, distributed computing, big data analytics and data visualization tools (Tableu, Qlik, Power BI).
Ability to profile a database using SQL to understand data inconsistencies and issues.
Experience in bank / financial institution systems would be favorable.
Knowledge of Adobe Analytics / Campaign is a strong plus.
Knowledge of data visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, is a strong plus.
Good verbal and written communication skills.
University degree, preferably in computer science, Information Systems, Business Analytics or related disciplines.
Minimum 3 years working experience in data analytics or business intelligence units, preferably in financial industry.
Self-motivated. Can-do spirit.
Industry:
•
Banking/ Financial Services
•
IT/ Computers - Software
•
Any
Role:
•
Software Engineer/ Programmer
•
Team Leader/ Technical Leader
•
Datawarehousing Consultants

Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities
End to end responsible for the solution and Design of the platform and application solution. Ensure the application is scalable, stable and extensible.
Responsible for designing developing application frameworks using Java Programming language, Java Script & related approved software technologies.
Responsible for executing software design and development from conceptual phase to testing phase for these framework
Responsible to perform research, development and POC on new technologies and development approaches. Take part in evaluation of software package
Responsible for mentoring and training of application team. Maintenance of the solution, framework, document pertaining to Pivotal Cloud Foundry
Provide operational assistance and guidance for Pivotal Cloud Foundry including; monitoring, management, disaster recovery, security compliance/auditing, networking, storage, service brokers and build packs
Work with customer Service Desk, Event Management, Incident Management, Problem Management, Configuration Management and Change Management Processes for all Cloud Services.
Establish and maintain continuous delivery pipelines for deployment of Pivotal Cloud Foundry and related products infrastructure
Design and implement continuous integration and continuous delivery processes to deliver customer apps to production, fostering a culture of continuous process improvement
Continuously learn and be at the leading edge of Pivotal and industry trends
Become an agent of change within organizations
Requirements
Bachelor in Computer Engineering or equivalent
Experience in release management or production operations, leading teams performing systems automation and integration (leveraging an agile methodology / lean techniques)
Experience with Jenkins, Hudson, Bamboo, TeamCity, and other Continuous Integration tools
Competent in using scripting + programming languages to automate frequently executed activities
2+ years IaaS experience (vSphere / ESXi / AWS / OpenStack / Azure / GCP)
Expert knowledge of Linux / Unix / Windows systems
Expert knowledge of networking and related technologies (e.g. load balancing / DNS / SSL / firewalls / NAT)
A clear understanding of cloud service and deployment models
Experienced in designing and developing PaaS-ready applications
Knowledge in domain-driven design methodologies desired
Experience on developing service-based applications
Excellent knowledge and experience in design patterns
Need to be open minded. Able to see high level vision and yet able to focus on the steps and details necessary to achieve the necessary goals
Creative and able to solve business problem using the right amount of software tool/solution
Proven track record of participating in the design and delivery of application solutions with infrastructure
Proficient in MS Office, Powerpoint and able to produce board-level documentation with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Strong experience in agile methodologies and test driven development
May be required to travel to multiple locations
Technical Competency with some of the following:
Experience with a platform as a service product such as Cloud Foundry, Heroku, Elastic Beanstalk, or similar
2+ years’ experience with Chef, Puppet, BOSH, or related automation / orchestration tools
Some experience working with NTP, SAML, oAuth 2, Active Directory
Solid understanding of systems monitoring, alerting and analytics (NewRelic, AppDynamics, Cacti, Graphite, Logstash, Nagios, Ganglia, Splunk, vROPS, Datadog, etc.)
A software development or DevOps automation background is a big plus

job_desc:
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities
Review account closure documents received from various sources such as customers, branches, Business Units according to standard guidelines within stipulated Service Level Agreement (SLA) before processing any balance refunds
Process rejection letter for incomplete documentations or unclear closure instructions and verify customer’s signatures via bank records to ensure legitimate of letter closure instructions
Conduct customer call-back confirmations for accounts with high balance refunds and/or from high-risk countries and escalate case if required
Understand Company’s closure letter and identify/ensure the details of the mode of preferred payment on balance refund, such as Cashier’s Order, Telegraphic Transfers etc are indicated clearly
Support Business Units for miscellaneous instructions (such as waiver/updating credit interest fee, cheque fee, fall below fee, overdraft interest, request chequebook, statement of account etc) by ensuring the relevant Delegation of Authority (DOA), General Ledger (GL) and PC Code are given
Process Company name change requests and requisite new cheque books once updated
Support account managers with their queries by demonstrating extensive product and operational knowledge
Challenges status quo and generates new ideas for continuous process improvement
Review and update department’s SOP on a regular basis
Perform User Acceptance Testing (UAT) on system enhancements when required
Understand and ensure bank policies such as Anti-Money Laundering/Cash-Flow Transactional, Audit and Compliance policies are adhered in a timely manner; any exceptions to escalate to Team Leader/Supervisor immediately
Support Team Leader/Supervisor in any ad-hoc projects and tasks given
Requirements
Degree holder, majoring in any field.
1 – 3 years of relevant experience in corporate account opening, preferably in banking industry.
Meticulous and detailed.
Strong adaptability in fast paced environment.
Able to work in a fast paced environment, handle pressure and multi task.
Team player who is able to work independently.

job_title: Wealth Planning Manager (Insurance Specialist) (Branch/Non-Branch), Consumer Banking Group
skill:
Wealth Planning Manager (Insurance Specialist) (Branch/Non-Branch)
Consumer Banking Group
job_desc:
Help our customers achieve their ambitions
DBS Consumer Banking Group plays a vital role in understanding and meeting customer
needs by offering the right products and services, from investments to insurance, to the right
customer segments. We help our customers realise their dreams at every life stage by helping
them grow and maintain the integrity of their portfolios.
As a
Wealth Planning Manager (Insurance Specialist)
with Asia’s best bank, you will help to shape our customers’ aspirations, by fulfilling their insurance needs with diverse and innovative financial solutions. You will be posted to either a Branch or Non-Branch team, where you need to build strong relationships with customers and customise their financial plans based on their needs.
Fast paced and challenging, your workday might look like this:
•    Provide one-stop financial advisory solutions at the bank branches through insurance services and products, such as retirement planning, savings and financial protection
•    Conduct regular financial planning interviews with existing and potential customers to assess their banking needs
•    Be actively involved in bank-wide campaigns and branch initiatives
•    If based in a Non-Branch environment, you will be assigned to a centralized office where focus will be on tele-prospecting
We want fast learners like you who:
•    Have a degree in any discipline
•    Are comfortable with flexible working schedule that includes weekends
•    Have a strong passion for banking and wealth management
What we offer
You can expect a competitive salary, a wide-ranging incentive, rewards and benefits package and rigorous training programmes will also be offered. Find out more
here
.
Ready to apply? Take the next step.
Click on the link below to apply and receive an email notification from our AI Chatbot, JIM within 2 hours
Interact and complete the mandatory assessments on JIM
You will be invited for a face-to-face interview with our Branch Manager and HR if you are shortlisted

job_title: AVP / Senior Associate, AI Deployment Engineer, IBG Digital, Institutional Banking Group
skill:
AVP / Senior Associate
AI Deployment Engineer
IBG Digital
Institutional Banking Group
job_desc:
Business Function
The Institutional Banking Group’s (IBG) Digital team strategizes and drives the Digital roadmap to lead the digital transformation of the IBG business globally. Govern and enable the engagement with various business partners and groups, client coverage, core product, country and regional sales, technology, operations and control partners. Ensuring the operating model in collaboration with all stakeholders is strictly followed to our digital framework to build the Eco-Systems, Acquire via the appropriate digital channels, Transact and Engage with the client in the most meaningful way.
The Digital Development Team is a subset of the broader Digital team and we own the development of digital product strategy and capabilities across the business and customers. Incubate and conceptualize digital tools and solutions to meet market, customer and operational needs end to end. A close collaborating team to existing core product teams and business partners in solution development.
Job Purpose
The AI (Artificial Intelligence) Deployment Engineer will provide software engineering support to the Institutional Banking Group (IBG) Business Analytics Team in various data science projects. This role’s primary job responsibility is facilitating the wrapping of data science work into a viable product. The right candidate will be one excited by opportunities to apply software engineering in the fast-growing area of AI, help build AI development and production infrastructure, as well as to set technical standards.
Responsibilities
Build, manage and automate pipelines for AI model development
Adopt maintainable, readable, modular solutions using modern software engineering best practices
Transform Data Science work into pilot and minimum viable products
Perform code optimization, code reviews to improve the quality of Data Scientist’s work
Create APIs for integrate data source into applications
Create APIs for downstream usage of AI models
Create visualisations to display views of AI models
Keep track of model development iterations with a versioning control system
Automate software testing: unit test, branch test, integration test and security test
Monitor AI model releases, branches for different issues and user stories
Requirements
Master’s Degree in software Engineering, Computer Science or related fields with minimum 5 years software engineering work experience on enterprise products
Experience with multi-tier software application development with best software engineering practices
Familiar with tools such as Anaconda, Jupyter, Eclipse, R Studio, Jira, Git, SVN, Jenkins, etc
Demonstrated proficiency in Python (Pandas, SciPy, NumPy, PySpark, etc), Scala, R, Java, Java Script, SQL, Shell Script
Experience with big data stack (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc), and structured (SQL) and unstructured databases (Graph Database, NoSQL)
Experience with virtual computing (virtual machine and Docker) for creation of easily transportable and self-contained environments
Experience with converting AI models and integrating them into production
Experience with code reviews, building interfaces, and deployment systems
Demonstrated strong interests in learning about AI through own initiatives
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Job Purpose
It exists to ensure that clients’ entitlements to corporate action events are protected.
It is expected to meet or exceed clients SLA requirements and achieve high standard of quality and commitment by specifying the roles and responsibility of each staff.
Key Accountabilities
Timeliness – to ensure that all Corporate Announcements & processing are done within 24 hours of receipt of announcements or proceeds
Accuracy – to ensure at least 95% accuracy
Responsive – to ensure that all clients queries are responded to within 24 hours of receipt of query or if not to provide interim reply and to follow with a response within 3 days
Risk- to ensure that there are no critical audit findings / issues and to escalate any immediate and time critical issues to higher authorities.
People – to participate in staff surveys, attend training when nominated and be crossed trained in other areas of work within the section or across sections in order to become a well trained leave cover.
Responsibilities
Check and ensure that all corporate action events are processed correctly and promptly.
Ensure prompt notification to clients on voluntary corporate action events such as rights, dividend with options, expiry of warrants, redemption, etc.
Check that clients’ instructions are executed accordingly.
Ensure that clients’ entitlements are protected.
Handle clients’ enquiries and provide timely responses.
Maintain high standard of service quality.

Degree in any discipline.
Minimum 2-3yrs of relevant experience in Corp Action.
Proficient in MS Office application.
Excellent interpersonal & communication skills.
Team player who can work independently with minimal supervision.
Able to thrive in fast paced environment.
Detailed and meticulous.

They are now looking for an experienced banking Chief Financial Officer to be part of their next phrase of growth.
The Position
Reporting and working closely with the CEO, the CFO will manage a team of finance staff and be responsible for the accounting and finance of the organization. He/she will be responsible for the financial reporting, financial analysis, treasury, tax and liaising with auditors. The CFO will also need to improve working practices and procedures and recommend potential financial operational efficiencies.
The Person
The ideal candidate should be a Chartered Accountant with an Accountancy or Finance Degree and at least 10 years of relevant experience. As the role will be based in Myanmar, my client welcomes candidates who are Burmese with international working experience that are interested to return to Myanmar or are already based in Myanmar. The client’s preference will be for candidates with prior banking experience. For the right candidate, there is excellent career progression and the opportunity to join a growing Bank.
Interested candidates may forward their CVs in MS Word Format to Yeo Wai Yin (R1107333) at waiyin@alphasearch.com or call +65 6828 1489 for a confidential discussion
Visit www.alphasearch.com for more exciting vacancies
Role:
•
Chartered Accountant (CPA)
•
Accounts Head
•
Finance Head/ GM Finance
•
VP Finance/ CFO
